moves.1. b4: Polish opening (did Mr. Topalov want to show off? ;-))
moves.1... d5: (not Nf6 or e5 ?) I wonder if computers would understand this game, lol.
moves.2. a4: (not Nf3 or c3?). the whole game will go mad ;-)
moves.2... c5: why not open the center (e5 or Nf6..). so far one would think this is an amateur game.
moves.3. f4: and an other odd move. not bXc5 or b5?
moves.3... b5: here I think black could have played cxb4 or e6.
moves.6. Nf3: hops, which human (or computer)  on earth would play Nf3 ;-) Why not Bxb5?
moves.6... e6 7. Nc3 g6 8. d5 Bg7 9. Nd2: this night runs from one lions mouth in an other, as you'll see. By the way why not Ne5 then or Bxc5+
moves.9... O-O: so far the first easy to understand & logical  move (for us).
moves.10. Be2 Re8 11. O-O Nfd7 12. Nc4: as I told you, this is the frustrated (Nf3) kamikaze horse ;-)
moves.14... exf5 15. Kh1: can you explain this move (Kh1)? I'd have moved fxe5.
moves.16... Nf7 17. Nxb5 Re7 18. Ra3 a6 19. h3: not d6? What is Topalov's plan? Bh5, Nb5,b4(..a3) all hanging.
moves.19... Nh6: what is then black's plan? why not axb5? This is why these over 2500 rating guys are so special, they see things(ghosts ,lol) we don't.
moves.23. Kxh2 gxh5 24. Kh1 a5 25. bxa5 Qe7 26: I think black looks somewhat stronger here but they agreed for draw after next move.
moves.27... Bxa6: an unusual game, don't you think? why draw though? If I were black I'd continue.cheers

gameName: this is a very odd game played in 2004, Ajaccio (Fra), I'd apreciate your comments.
